keyTakeAways: Kansei Matsuzawa, a 26-year-old from Ichikawa, Japan, made global headlines by successfully kicking a game-winning field goal in the NCAA college football season against Stanford, becoming a symbol of perseverance and self-education.
He learned to kick football and improve his English by watching YouTube videos, including those of NFL players like Jason Myers, and was inspired by baseball star Shohei Ohtani for his work ethic.
Matsuzawa's journey included overcoming personal setbacks such as failing an exam in Japan, financial hardship (e.g., working as a waiter and cutting his own hair), and language barriers.
His parents made significant sacrifices, including relocating to the U.S. and moving to a cheaper home, to support his dream.
He received a scholarship to the University of Hawaii, where he is studying sports management, and has been recognized by coaches like Thomas Sheffield for his resilience and personal growth.
Matsuzawa dreams of playing in the NFL and becoming the first Japanese national to do so, aiming for a Super Bowl victory and a long career with a major contract.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Kansei Matsuzawa, a 26-year-old from Ichikawa, Japan, rose to global prominence after scoring a game-winning 38-yard field goal against Stanford in the opening weekend of the NCAA college football season, becoming a symbol of perseverance and self-driven learning. Despite having no formal coaching, no English proficiency, and limited exposure to American football, Matsuzawa taught himself the sport by studying YouTube videos, including those of NFL players like Jason Myers. His journey includes overcoming personal setbacks, financial hardship, and language barriers, supported by his parents’ sacrifices. He earned a scholarship to the University of Hawaii, where he studies sports management, and has inspired both coaches and fans with his resilience. Matsuzawa, who is inspired by Japanese baseball superstar Shohei Ohtani, now dreams of playing in the NFL and becoming the first Japanese national to do so, with ambitions of winning a Super Bowl and securing a long-term career.
title: The NFL hopeful from Japan who learned to kick on YouTube
